byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Paris, and Scott Shane from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Charlie Savage and Jackie Calmes from Washington, and Daphné Anglès and Elian Peltier from Paris.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and SCOTT SHANE

abstract: French government reacts with modulated response to information published by WikiLeaks and media groups that United States' National Security Agency spied on French presidents and other senior officials from 2016 to 2012.
lead_paragraph: The government reacted with anger after WikiLeaks released reports of extensive eavesdropping by the United States of senior French leaders, including three presidents.

headline.main: Hollande Condemns Spying by U.S., but Not Too Harshly
headline.print_headline: France Condemns Spying by N.S.A., but Not Too Harshly

snippet: The government reacted with anger after WikiLeaks released reports of extensive eavesdropping by the United States of senior French leaders, including three presidents.
